title: Average wine consumption per U.S. resident 2005 to 2018
summary: The chart at hand is a line chart where the x axis denotes Year and a y axis denotes Consumption per resident in gallons. In total the number of data points it has is 14.
In general Consumption per resident in gallons has rose over the Year.
The steepest increase occurs in between the Year 2010 and 2011.
Maximum Consumption per resident in gallons, about 2.95 was reported at Year 2018
The lowest Consumption per resident in gallons, of value 2.32 was reported at Year 2005
min_summary: This is a line chart with an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Consumption per resident in gallons, containing a total of 14 data points.
Overall Consumption per resident in gallons has increased over the Year.

Consumption per resident in gallons is slightly increasing from 2005 to 2007, roughly constant from 2007 to 2008, rapidly increasing from 2008 to 2012, roughly constant from 2012 to 2014, roughly increasing from 2014 to 2015, and lastly roughly constant from 2015 to 2018.
mid_summary: The chart at hand is a line chart where the x axis denotes Year and a y axis denotes Consumption per resident in gallons. In total the number of data points it has is 14.
Overall Consumption per resident in gallons has increased over the Year.

Consumption per resident in gallons is slightly increasing from 2005 to 2007, roughly constant from 2007 to 2008, rapidly increasing from 2008 to 2012, roughly constant from 2012 to 2014, roughly increasing from 2014 to 2015, and lastly roughly constant from 2015 to 2018.
The most drastic increase took place within the Year 2010 and 2011.
Maximum Consumption per resident in gallons, about 2.95 was reported at Year 2018
The lowest Consumption per resident in gallons, of value 2.32 was reported at Year 2005
